meanings.definition: To disconnect (an electrical device) from a power source.
meanings.sent1: I always make sure to unplug my phone before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: Remember to unplug the toaster after you finish using it.
meanings.sent3: The lamp was tired of being plugged in all day, so it asked for a break by unplugging itself.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the town decided to unplug all electronic devices to stay safe.
meanings.sent5: The magician amazed the audience by unplugging a working television without touching it.

meanings.definition: To take a break or disconnect from technology or work.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of meetings, I like to unwind by unplugging from my emails.
meanings.sent2: It's important to unplug from social media occasionally to focus on real-life connections.
meanings.sent3: The robot decided to unplug itself and go on a digital detox vacation.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was unplugging from the world when she turned off her phone and went for a walk in nature.
meanings.sent5: The artist found inspiration by unplugging from distractions and spending time in solitude.
